Class MazeTraversal

  • java.lang.Object
    • MazeTraversal

  • public final class MazeTraversal
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a final class that traverses through a maze of char array. It contains one class variable, one constructor, and three methods. It is meant to be used as a utility class Credit: http://www.octopusfunda.com/2015/05/maze-traversal-using-recursive.html

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static int moves 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      private MazeTraversal()
      This constructor is private so that no user can create an instance of this class as this class is meant to be used a utility class.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private static void mazeTraversal(char[][] maze, int i, int j)
      This static method traverses through the maze by going to the direction whenever there's a path available.
      static void printMaze(char[][] maze)
      This class prints the maze given the maze in char array
      static void traverse(char[][] maze, int startRow, int startColumn)
      This is a method that traverse through the maze by calling the static mazeTraversal method.

      • traverse

        public static void traverse(char[][] maze,
                            int startRow,
                            int startColumn)
        This is a method that traverse through the maze by calling the static mazeTraversal method. It has
        Parameters:
        maze - the maze in char array
        startRow - the row of where to start
        startColumn - the column of where to start

      • printMaze

        public static void printMaze(char[][] maze)

      • mazeTraversal

        private static void mazeTraversal(char[][] maze,
                                  int i,
                                  int j)
        This static method traverses through the maze by going to the direction whenever there's a path available. It applies recursive backtracking
        Parameters:
        maze - maze
        i - the row of the X
        j - the column of the X
